instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1708: What is A1708? A1708 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Mid 2017, 2016 with EMC 3164, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00840, 820-00875..
definitions.820-00840: What is 820-00840? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.ALL_SYS_PWRGD: What is ALL_SYS_PWRGD? ALL_SYS_PWRGD is present when PP1V8_S3, PP5V_S3, PP1V2_S3, PP1V05_S0, PP5V_S0, PP3V3_S0, & PP1V5_S0 are present and working. If any of these rails is not working, ALL_SYS_PWRGD will be pulled down and the machine will not turn on. .
definitions.PM_PCH_PWROK: What is PM_PCH_PWROK? PM_PCH_PWROK is usually created by U1950, a 74LVC2G08GT chip and is necessary for the machine to wake from an S5 and S4 state and turn on. This signal will be present if ALL_SYS_PWRGD, CPU_VR_PGOOD, PP3V3_S0, and PP3V42_G3H are present. When this signal is not present or intermittent, usually pin 8 on U1950 for PP3V42_G3H is corroded..

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1708</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>  <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A NO DISPLAY
threads.message:
HI,
I have a <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1708</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> mac...part no is <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>--A
in my c type reader its take 0.465 ma
all coil voltages are active...but 
<SIGNAL>PPVCCGT_S0G_PH3</SIGNAL>
missing (there is no voltages on L7410,L7420,L7430)

[TABLE]
[TR]
[TD]<SIGNAL>ALL_SYS_PWRGD</SIGNAL>[/TD]
[/TR]
[/TABLE]
 
Get 3.2 v

[TABLE]
[TR]
[TD]<SIGNAL>PM_PCH_SYS_PWROK</SIGNAL>[/TD]
[/TR]
[/TABLE]
 
 get 0v

[TABLE]
[TR]
[TD]<SIGNAL>PM_PCH_PWROK</SIGNAL>[/TD]
[/TR]
[/TABLE]
 
get 3.12v

Then i trace 
[TABLE]
[TR]
[TD]<SIGNAL>PM_PCH_SYS_PWROK</SIGNAL>

this is the pwrgood of <CHIP>U7700</CHIP>..there is no voltage on 20th pin of <CHIP>U7700</CHIP>....


[TABLE]
[TR]
[TD]<SIGNAL>PP1V_OPC_S0</SIGNAL>[/TD]
[/TR]
[/TABLE]
 
I get 1 v

WHAT NEXT...?
[/TD]
[/TR]
[/TABLE]

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1708</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>  <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A NO DISPLAY
threads.message:
"<SIGNAL>PPVCCGT_S0G_PH3</SIGNAL>
missing"
iGPU core voltage will not appear, until high graphics load is detected.

What is CPU core voltage (L7210/20)?

Stuck on 0.96V?
Check it after 10-15s.

<SIGNAL>PM_PGOOD_CPUVCC</SIGNAL> comes high?

<MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1708</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>  <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A NO DISPLAY
threads.message:
Check if <CHIP>U7800</CHIP> (1 OF 10) gets all signals from left side (pag 60).
Also check <SIGNAL>PM_PGOOD</SIGNAL> signals listed bellow that area.
